PeImportDirectory.C

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /* PE Import Directory. A PE Import Section is a list of PE Import Directories. */
00002 #include "sage3basic.h"
00003 #include "MemoryMap.h"
00004 
00017 void
00018 SgAsmPEImportDirectory::ctor(SgAsmPEImportSection *section, const std::string &dll_name)
00019 {
00020     ROSE_ASSERT(section!=NULL); /* needed for parsing */
00021     section->add_import_directory(this);
00022     p_time = time(NULL);
00023 
00024     p_dll_name = new SgAsmBasicString(dll_name);
00025     p_dll_name->set_parent(this);
00026 
00027     p_imports = new SgAsmPEImportItemList;
00028     p_imports->set_parent(this);
00029 }
00030 
00034 size_t
00035 SgAsmPEImportDirectory::iat_required_size() const
00036 {
00037     SgAsmPEFileHeader *fhdr = SageInterface::getEnclosingNode<SgAsmPEFileHeader>(this);
00038     assert(fhdr!=NULL);
00039     return (p_imports->get_vector().size() + 1) * fhdr->get_word_size();
00040 }
00041 
00044 int
00045 SgAsmPEImportDirectory::find_import_item(const SgAsmPEImportItem *item, int hint) const
00046 {
00047     const SgAsmPEImportItemPtrList &imports = get_imports()->get_vector();
00048     if (hint>=0 && (size_t)hint<imports.size() && imports[hint]==item)
00049         return hint;
00050     for (size_t i=0; i<imports.size(); ++i) {
00051         if (imports[i]==item)
00052             return i;
00053     }
00054     return -1;
00055 }
00056 
00066 size_t
00067 SgAsmPEImportDirectory::hintname_table_extent(ExtentMap &extent/*in,out*/) const
00068 {
00069     size_t retval = 0;
00070     const SgAsmPEImportItemPtrList &imports = get_imports()->get_vector();
00071     for (SgAsmPEImportItemPtrList::const_iterator ii=imports.begin(); ii!=imports.end(); ++ii) {
00072         SgAsmPEImportItem *import = *ii;
00073         if (!import->get_by_ordinal() && import->get_hintname_rva().get_rva()!=0 && import->get_hintname_nalloc()>0) {
00074             size_t nbytes = std::min(import->get_hintname_nalloc(), import->hintname_required_size());
00075             extent.insert(Extent(import->get_hintname_rva().get_va(), nbytes));
00076             ++retval;
00077         }
00078     }
00079     return retval;
00080 }
00081 
00085 SgAsmPEImportDirectory *
00086 SgAsmPEImportDirectory::parse(rose_addr_t idir_va)
00087 {
00088     SgAsmPEFileHeader *fhdr = SageInterface::getEnclosingNode<SgAsmPEFileHeader>(this);
00089     ROSE_ASSERT(fhdr!=NULL);
00090 
00091     /* Read the import directory from disk via loader map. */
00092     PEImportDirectory_disk disk, zero;
00093     memset(&zero, 0, sizeof zero);
00094     size_t nread = fhdr->get_loader_map()->read(&disk, idir_va, sizeof disk);
00095     if (nread!=sizeof disk) {
00096         SgAsmPEImportSection::import_mesg("SgAsmPEImportDirectory::parse: short read (%zu byte%s) of directory "
00097                                           "at va 0x%08"PRIx64" (needed %zu bytes)\n",
00098                                           nread, 1==nread?"":"s", idir_va, sizeof disk);
00099         memset(&disk, 0, sizeof disk);
00100     }
00101 
00102     /* An all-zero entry marks the end of the list. In this case return null. */
00103     if (!memcmp(&disk, &zero, sizeof zero))
00104         return NULL;
00105 
00106     p_ilt_rva         = le_to_host(disk.ilt_rva);
00107     p_time            = le_to_host(disk.time);
00108     p_forwarder_chain = le_to_host(disk.forwarder_chain);
00109     p_dll_name_rva    = le_to_host(disk.dll_name_rva);
00110     p_iat_rva         = le_to_host(disk.iat_rva);
00111 
00112     /* Bind RVAs to best sections */
00113     p_ilt_rva.bind(fhdr);
00114     p_dll_name_rva.bind(fhdr);
00115     p_iat_rva.bind(fhdr);
00116 
00117     /* Library name.  The PE format specification does not require the name to be contained in the import section, but we issue
00118      * a warning because ROSE may have problems allocating new space for the name if it's changed. */
00119     ROSE_ASSERT(p_dll_name!=NULL);
00120     std::string dll_name;
00121     if (0==p_dll_name_rva.get_section()) {
00122         SgAsmPEImportSection::import_mesg("SgAsmPEImportDirectory::parse: import directory at va 0x%08"PRIx64
00123                                           " has bad DLL name rva %s\n", idir_va, p_dll_name_rva.to_string().c_str());
00124     } else {
00125         try {
00126             dll_name = p_dll_name_rva.get_section()->read_content_str(fhdr->get_loader_map(), p_dll_name_rva.get_rva());
00127         } catch (const MemoryMap::NotMapped &e) {
00128             if (SgAsmPEImportSection::import_mesg("SgAsmPEImportDirectory::parse: short read of dll name at rva %s for "
00129                                                   " import directory at va 0x%08"PRIx64"\n",
00130                                                   p_dll_name_rva.to_string().c_str(), idir_va) &&
00131                 e.map) {
00132                 fprintf(stderr, "    Memory map in effect at time of error is:\n");
00133                 e.map->dump(stderr, "        ");
00134             }
00135         }
00136     }
00137     p_dll_name->set_string(dll_name);
00138     p_dll_name_nalloc = dll_name.size() + 1;
00139 
00140     parse_ilt_iat(p_ilt_rva, false);
00141     p_ilt_nalloc = 0==p_ilt_rva.get_rva() ? 0 : iat_required_size();
00142 
00143     parse_ilt_iat(p_iat_rva, false); // IAT initially is a copy of the ILT (i.e., objects are not bound to addresses yet)
00144     p_iat_nalloc = 0==p_iat_rva.get_rva() ? 0 : iat_required_size();
00145 
00146     return this;
00147 }
00148 
00158 void
00159 SgAsmPEImportDirectory::parse_ilt_iat(const rose_rva_t &table_start, bool assume_bound)
00160 {
00161     SgAsmPEImportSection *isec = SageInterface::getEnclosingNode<SgAsmPEImportSection>(this);
00162     assert(isec!=NULL);
00163     SgAsmPEFileHeader *fhdr = isSgAsmPEFileHeader(isec->get_header());
00164     assert(fhdr!=NULL);
00165     assert(fhdr->get_word_size() <= sizeof(uint64_t));
00166     assert(get_imports()!=NULL);
00167     SgAsmPEImportItemPtrList &imports = get_imports()->get_vector();
00168     bool processing_iat = !imports.empty(); // we always process the ILT first (but it might be empty)
00169     
00170     if (0==table_start.get_rva())
00171         return;                 // no ILT/IAT present
00172 
00173 
00174     rose_addr_t entry_rva=table_start.get_rva(), entry_size=fhdr->get_word_size();
00175     uint64_t by_ordinal_bit = 1ull << (8*entry_size-1);
00176 
00177     for (size_t idx=0; 1; ++idx, entry_rva+=entry_size) {
00178         /* Read the 32- or 64-bit ILT/IAT entry from proces mapped memory. */
00179         uint64_t entry_word = 0;
00180         try {
00181             isec->read_content(fhdr->get_loader_map(), entry_rva, &entry_word, entry_size);
00182         } catch (const MemoryMap::NotMapped &e) {
00183             if (SgAsmPEImportSection::import_mesg("SgAsmPEImportDirectory: ILT/IAT entry #%zu at rva 0x%08"PRIx64
00184                                                   ": table entry is outside mapped memory\n", idx, entry_rva) && e.map) {
00185                 fprintf(stderr, "    Memory map in effect at time of error:\n");
00186                 e.map->dump(stderr, "        ");
00187             }
00188         }
00189         entry_word = le_to_host(entry_word);
00190 
00191         /* ILT/IAT are to be terminated by a zero word.  However, the length of the IAT is required to be the same as the
00192          * length of the ILT. Handle three cases here:
00193          *      (1) Termination of the ILT by a zero entry; stop now
00194          *      (2) Premature termination of the IAT; continue processing
00195          *      (3) Missing (or late) termination of the IAT; stop now */
00196         if (0==entry_word) {
00197             if (idx<imports.size()) {
00198                 SgAsmPEImportSection::import_mesg("SgAsmPEImportDirectory: IAT entry #%zu at rva 0x%08"PRIx64
00199                                                   ": IAT zero termination occurs before end of corresponding ILT;"
00200                                                   " %scontinuing to read IAT entries.\n", idx, entry_rva,
00201                                                   (assume_bound?"":"assuming this is a bound null address and "));
00202                 assert(idx<imports.size());
00203                 imports[idx]->set_bound_rva(rose_rva_t(entry_word).bind(fhdr));
00204                 continue;
00205             } else {
00206                 break;
00207             }
00208         } else if (processing_iat && idx>=imports.size()) {
00209             SgAsmPEImportSection::import_mesg("SgAsmPEImportDirectory: IAT entry #%zu at rva 0x%08"PRIx64
00210                                               ": IAT extends beyond end of corresponding ILT (it is not zero terminated)"
00211                                               "; forcibly terminating here\n", idx, entry_rva);
00212             break;
00213         }
00214 
00215         /* Create the new table entry if necessary. */
00216         bool entry_existed = true;
00217         if (idx>=imports.size()) {
00218             assert(idx==imports.size());
00219             new SgAsmPEImportItem(get_imports()); // adds new item to imports list
00220             entry_existed = false;
00221         }
00222         SgAsmPEImportItem *import_item = imports[idx];
00223 
00224         if (assume_bound) {
00225             /* The entry word is a virtual address. */
00226             if (entry_existed && import_item->get_bound_rva().get_rva()>0 &&
00227                 import_item->get_bound_rva().get_rva()!=entry_word) {
00228                 SgAsmPEImportSection::import_mesg("SgAsmPEImportDirectory: ILT/IAT entry #%zu at rva 0x%08"PRIx64
00229                                                   ": bound address 0x%08"PRIx64" conflicts with bound address already"
00230                                                   " discovered 0x%08"PRIx64" (using new value)\n", idx, entry_rva, entry_word,
00231                                                   import_item->get_bound_rva().get_rva());
00232             }
00233             import_item->set_bound_rva(rose_rva_t(entry_word).bind(fhdr));
00234         } else if (0!=(entry_word & by_ordinal_bit)) {
00235             /* The entry is an ordinal number. */
00236             if (entry_existed && import_item->get_ordinal()!=0 && import_item->get_ordinal()!=(entry_word & 0xffff)) {
00237                 SgAsmPEImportSection::import_mesg("SgAsmPEImportDirectory: ILT/IAT entry #%zu at rva 0x%08"PRIx64
00238                                                   ": ordinal %"PRIu64" conflicts with ordinal already discovered %u"
00239                                                   " (assuming this is a bound address)\n", idx, entry_rva, (entry_word&0xffff),
00240                                                   import_item->get_ordinal());
00241                 import_item->set_bound_rva(rose_rva_t(entry_word).bind(fhdr));
00242             } else {
00243                 import_item->set_by_ordinal(true);
00244                 import_item->set_ordinal(entry_word & 0xffff);
00245                 if (0!=(entry_word & ~(by_ordinal_bit | 0xffff))) {
00246                     SgAsmPEImportSection::import_mesg("SgAsmPEImportDirectory: ILT/IAT entry #%zu at rva 0x%08"PRIx64
00247                                                       ": contains extra bits in violation of PE specification"
00248                                                       " (extra bits removed)\n", idx, entry_rva);
00249                 }
00250             }
00251         } else {
00252             /* The entry word points to a Hint/Name pair: a 2-byte, little endian hint, followed by a NUL-terminated string,
00253              * followed by an optional extra byte to make the total length a multiple of two. */
00254             if (entry_existed && import_item->get_by_ordinal()) {
00255                 SgAsmPEImportSection::import_mesg("SgAsmPEImportDirectory: ILT/IAT entry #%zu at rva 0x%08"PRIx64
00256                                                   ": entry type \"hint/name\" conflicts with entry type already discovered"
00257                                                   " \"ordinal\" (assuming this is a bound address)\n", idx, entry_rva);
00258                 import_item->set_bound_rva(rose_rva_t(entry_word).bind(fhdr));
00259             } else if (entry_existed && import_item->get_hintname_rva().get_rva()>0 &&
00260                        import_item->get_hintname_rva().get_rva()!=entry_word) {
00261                 SgAsmPEImportSection::import_mesg("SgAsmPEImportDirectory: ILT/IAT entry #%zu at rva 0x%08"PRIx64
00262                                                   ": hint/name rva 0x%08"PRIx64" conflicts with hint/name rva already"
00263                                                   " discovered 0x%08"PRIx64" (assuming this is a bound address)\n",
00264                                                   idx, entry_rva, entry_word, import_item->get_hintname_rva().get_rva());
00265                 import_item->set_bound_rva(rose_rva_t(entry_word).bind(fhdr));
00266             } else {
00267                 import_item->set_by_ordinal(false);
00268                 import_item->set_hintname_rva(rose_rva_t(entry_word).bind(fhdr));
00269                 import_item->set_hintname_nalloc(0); // for now, will adjust after we read it
00270                 uint16_t hint;
00271                 try {
00272                     isec->read_content(fhdr->get_loader_map(), entry_word, &hint, sizeof hint);
00273                 } catch (const MemoryMap::NotMapped &e) {
00274                     import_item->set_hint(0);
00275                     import_item->get_name()->set_string("");
00276                     if (SgAsmPEImportSection::import_mesg("SgAsmPEImportDirectory: ILT/IAT entry #%zu at rva 0x%08"PRIx64
00277                                                           ": points to unmapped Hint/Name pair at 0x%08"PRIx64
00278                                                           " (when reading hint)\n", idx, entry_rva, entry_word) && e.map) {
00279                         fprintf(stderr, "    Memory map in effect at time of error:\n");
00280                         e.map->dump(stderr, "        ");
00281                     }
00282                     continue; // to next ILT/IAT entry
00283                 }
00284                 hint = le_to_host(hint);
00285                 import_item->set_hint(hint);
00286 
00287                 std::string s;
00288                 try {
00289                     s = isec->read_content_str(fhdr->get_loader_map(), entry_word+2);
00290                 } catch (const MemoryMap::NotMapped &e) {
00291                     import_item->get_name()->set_string("");
00292                     if (SgAsmPEImportSection::import_mesg("SgAsmPEImportDirectory: ILT/IAT entry #%zu at rva 0x%08"PRIx64
00293                                                           ": points to an unmapped Hint/Name pair at 0x%08"PRIx64
00294                                                           " (when reading name)\n", idx, entry_rva, entry_word) && e.map) {
00295                         fprintf(stderr, "    Memory map in effect at time of error:\n");
00296                         e.map->dump(stderr, "        ");
00297                     }
00298                     continue; // to next ILT/IAT entry
00299                 }
00300                 import_item->get_name()->set_string(s);
00301 
00302                 if ((s.size()+1)  % 2) {
00303                     uint8_t byte = 0;
00304                     try {
00305                         isec->read_content(fhdr->get_loader_map(), entry_word+2+s.size()+1, &byte, 1);
00306                     } catch (const MemoryMap::NotMapped &e) {
00307                         if (SgAsmPEImportSection::import_mesg("SgAsmPEImportDirectory: ILT/IAT entry #%zu at rva 0x%08"PRIx64
00308                                                               ": points to an unmapped Hint/Name pair at 0x%08"PRIx64
00309                                                               " (when reading pad byte)\n", idx, entry_rva, entry_word) && e.map) {
00310                             fprintf(stderr, "    Memory map in effect at time of error:\n");
00311                             e.map->dump(stderr, "        ");
00312                         }
00313                         continue; // to next ILT/IAT entry
00314                     }
00315                     if (byte) {
00316                         SgAsmPEImportSection::import_mesg("SgAsmPEImportDirctory: ILT/IAT entry #%zu at rva 0x%08"PRIx64
00317                                                           ": has a non-zero padding byte: 0x%02x\n", idx, entry_rva, byte);
00318                     }
00319                 }
00320                 import_item->set_hintname_nalloc(import_item->hintname_required_size());
00321             }
00322         }
00323     }
00324 }
00325 
00337 void
00338 SgAsmPEImportDirectory::unparse_ilt_iat(std::ostream &f, const rose_rva_t &table_start, bool assume_bound,
00339                                         size_t tablesize) const
00340 {
00341     SgAsmPEImportSection *isec = SageInterface::getEnclosingNode<SgAsmPEImportSection>(this);
00342     assert(isec!=NULL);
00343     SgAsmPEFileHeader *fhdr = isSgAsmPEFileHeader(isec->get_header());
00344     assert(fhdr!=NULL);
00345     assert(fhdr->get_word_size() <= sizeof(uint64_t));
00346     const SgAsmPEImportItemPtrList &imports = get_imports()->get_vector();
00347     size_t entry_size = fhdr->get_word_size();
00348     uint64_t by_ordinal_bit = 1ull << (8*entry_size-1);
00349 
00350     if (0==table_start.get_rva() || imports.empty())
00351         return;
00352     if (!table_start.get_section()) {
00353         SgAsmPEImportSection::import_mesg("SgAsmPEImportDirectory: ILT/IAT: table is not associated with a section: %s\n",
00354                                           table_start.to_string().c_str());
00355         return;
00356     }
00357 
00358     /* Must we limit how many entries are written? Don't forget the zero terminator. */
00359     size_t nelmts = std::min(tablesize/entry_size, imports.size()+1);
00360     if (nelmts<imports.size()+1) {
00361         SgAsmPEImportSection::import_mesg("SgAsmPEImportDirectory: ILT/IAT: table at 0x%08"PRIx64" is truncated from %zu to"
00362                                           " %zu entries (inc. zero terminator) due to allocation constraints.\n",
00363                                           table_start.to_string().c_str(), imports.size()+1, nelmts);
00364     }
00365 
00366     rose_rva_t entry_rva = table_start;
00367     for (size_t idx=0; idx<nelmts/*including zero terminator*/; ++idx, entry_rva.increment(entry_size)) {
00368         uint64_t entry_word = 0;
00369 
00370         /* Write the zero terminator? */
00371         if (idx+1==nelmts) {
00372             uint64_t zero = 0;
00373             entry_rva.get_section()->write(f, entry_rva.get_rel(), entry_size, &zero);
00374             break;
00375         }
00376 
00377         rose_rva_t hn_rva = imports[idx]->get_hintname_rva();
00378 
00379         /* Build the IAT/ILT entry */
00380         if (assume_bound) {
00381             entry_word = imports[idx]->get_bound_rva().get_rva();
00382         } else if (imports[idx]->get_by_ordinal()) {
00383             if (0!=(imports[idx]->get_ordinal() & ~0xffff)) {
00384                 SgAsmPEImportSection::import_mesg("SgAsmPEImportDirectory: ILT/IAT entry #%zu at rva 0x%08"PRIx64
00385                                                   ": ordinal is out of bounds: %u (truncated to 16 bits)\n",
00386                                                   idx, entry_rva.get_rva(), imports[idx]->get_ordinal());
00387             }
00388             entry_word |= by_ordinal_bit | (imports[idx]->get_ordinal() & 0xffff);
00389         } else if (0==hn_rva.get_rva() || NULL==hn_rva.get_section()) {
00390             SgAsmPEImportSection::import_mesg("SgAsmPEImportDirectory: ILT/IAT entry #%zu at rva 0x%08"PRIx64
00391                                               ": non-ordinal entry has invalid hint/name pair address %s or is"
00392                                               " not associated with any section.\n",
00393                                               idx, entry_rva.get_rva(), hn_rva.to_string().c_str());
00394             entry_word = hn_rva.get_rva(); // best we can do
00395         } else {
00396             size_t bufsz = std::min(imports[idx]->get_hintname_nalloc(), imports[idx]->hintname_required_size());
00397             if (bufsz < imports[idx]->hintname_required_size()) {
00398                 SgAsmPEImportSection::import_mesg("SgAsmPEImportDirectory: ILT/IAT entry #%zu at rva 0x%08"PRIx64
00399                                                   ": insufficient space (%zu byte%s) allocated for hint/name pair at"
00400                                                   " rva %s (need %zu bytes)\n",
00401                                                   idx, entry_rva.get_rva(), bufsz, 1==bufsz?"":"s",
00402                                                   hn_rva.to_string().c_str(), imports[idx]->hintname_required_size());
00403             }
00404             if (bufsz>=2) {
00405                 uint8_t *buf = new uint8_t[bufsz];
00406                 unsigned hint = imports[idx]->get_hint();
00407                 std::string name = imports[idx]->get_name()->get_string();
00408                 if (0!=(hint & ~0xffff)) {
00409                     SgAsmPEImportSection::import_mesg("SgAsmPEImportDirectory: ILT/IAT entry #%zu at rva 0x%08"PRIx64
00410                                                       ": hint is out of bounds: %u (truncated to 16 bits)\n",
00411                                                       idx, entry_rva.get_rva(), hint);
00412                 }
00413                 host_to_le(hint, &hint); // nudge, nudge. Know what I mean?
00414                 memcpy(buf, &hint, 2);
00415                 memcpy(buf+2, name.c_str(), std::min(name.size()+1, bufsz-2));
00416                 if (bufsz>2)
00417                     buf[bufsz-1] = '\0';
00418                 hn_rva.get_section()->write(f, hn_rva.get_rel(), bufsz, buf);
00419                 if (0!=(hn_rva.get_rva() & by_ordinal_bit)) {
00420                     SgAsmPEImportSection::import_mesg("SgAsmPEImportDirectory: ILT/IAT entry #%zu at rva 0x%08"PRIx64
00421                                                       ": hint/name pair rva 0x%08"PRIx64" has by_ordinal bit set\n",
00422                                                       idx, entry_rva.get_rva(), hn_rva.get_rva());
00423                 }
00424                 delete[] buf;
00425             }
00426             entry_word = hn_rva.get_rva() & ~by_ordinal_bit;
00427         }
00428 
00429         /* Write the IAT/ILT entry */
00430         if (0==entry_word) {
00431             SgAsmPEImportSection::import_mesg("SgAsmPEImportDirectory: ILT/IAT entry #%zu at rva 0x%08"PRIx64
00432                                               ": zero table entry will cause table to be truncated when read\n",
00433                                               idx, entry_rva.get_rva());
00434         }
00435         uint64_t disk = 0; // we might write only the first few bytes
00436         host_to_le(entry_word, &disk);
00437         entry_rva.get_section()->write(f, entry_rva.get_rel(), entry_size, &disk);
00438     }
00439 }
00440     
00442 void *
00443 SgAsmPEImportDirectory::encode(PEImportDirectory_disk *disk) const
00444 {
00445     host_to_le(p_ilt_rva.get_rva(),      &(disk->ilt_rva));
00446     host_to_le(p_time,                   &(disk->time));
00447     host_to_le(p_forwarder_chain,        &(disk->forwarder_chain));
00448     host_to_le(p_dll_name_rva.get_rva(), &(disk->dll_name_rva));
00449     host_to_le(p_iat_rva.get_rva(),      &(disk->iat_rva));
00450     return disk;
00451 }
00452 
00458 size_t
00459 SgAsmPEImportDirectory::reallocate(rose_rva_t start_rva)
00460 {
00461     rose_rva_t end_rva = start_rva;
00462     const SgAsmPEImportItemPtrList &imports = get_imports()->get_vector();
00463 
00464     /* Allocate space for the name if it hasn't been allocated already; reallocate space if its allocated in the import
00465      * section.  Allocate space even if the name is the empty string. */
00466     if (0==p_dll_name_rva.get_rva() || p_dll_name_rva.get_section()==end_rva.get_section()) {
00467         p_dll_name_nalloc = get_dll_name()->get_string().size() + 1;
00468         p_dll_name_rva = end_rva;
00469         end_rva.increment(p_dll_name_nalloc);
00470     }
00471 
00472     /* Allocate space for the import lookup table if it hasn't been allocated yet. The table is terminated with a zero
00473      * entry (as is the IAT according to the spec even though the IAT size is implied by the ILT size). */
00474     if (0==p_ilt_rva.get_rva() || p_ilt_rva.get_section()==end_rva.get_section()) {
00475         p_ilt_nalloc = iat_required_size(); // ILT and IAT are always the same size
00476         p_ilt_rva = end_rva;
00477         end_rva.increment(p_ilt_nalloc);
00478     }
00479 
00480     /* Allocate space for the import address table if it hasn't been allocated yet.   Note, the import address table should
00481      * usually be allocated explicitly because it is referenced by the program's instructions. */
00482     if (0==p_iat_rva.get_rva() || p_iat_rva.get_section()==end_rva.get_section()) {
00483         p_iat_nalloc = iat_required_size();
00484         p_iat_rva = end_rva;
00485         end_rva.increment(p_iat_nalloc);
00486     }
00487 
00488     /* Allocate space for the Hint/Name pairs that haven't been allocated yet.  The ILT and IAT will both point to the same
00489      * hint/name pair when the IAT is a copy of the ILT.  When the IAT is unparsed as bound addresses, then space for the
00490      * hint/name pair is still needed because the ILT still points to it.  We allocate space even for hint/name pairs that are
00491      * zero and the empty string.  We don't reallocate hint/name pairs that are stored in a different file section (so be
00492      * careful that you don't increase the length of the name). */
00493     for (size_t i=0; i<imports.size(); ++i) {
00494         if (!imports[i]->get_by_ordinal() &&
00495             (0==imports[i]->get_hintname_rva() || imports[i]->get_hintname_rva().get_section()==end_rva.get_section())) {
00496             size_t sz = imports[i]->hintname_required_size();
00497             imports[i]->set_hintname_nalloc(sz);
00498             imports[i]->set_hintname_rva(end_rva);
00499             end_rva.increment(sz);
00500         }
00501     }
00502 
00503     return end_rva.get_rva() - start_rva.get_rva();
00504 }
00505 
00506 void
00507 SgAsmPEImportDirectory::unparse(std::ostream &f, const SgAsmPEImportSection *section, size_t idx) const
00508 {
00509     /* The DLL name */
00510     if (0==p_dll_name_rva.get_rva() || NULL==p_dll_name_rva.get_section()) {
00511         SgAsmPEImportSection::import_mesg("SgAsmPEImportDirectory: DLL name address %s is invalid or not bound to"
00512                                           " any file section\n", p_dll_name_rva.to_string().c_str());
00513     } else if (p_dll_name->get_string().size()+1 > p_dll_name_nalloc) {
00514         SgAsmPEImportSection::import_mesg("SgAsmPEImportDirectory: insufficient space allocated (%zu byte%s) for DLL name"
00515                                           " (need %zu byte%s)\n", p_dll_name_nalloc, 1==p_dll_name_nalloc?"":"s",
00516                                           p_dll_name->get_string().size()+1, 1==p_dll_name->get_string().size()?"":"s");
00517     } else {
00518         uint8_t *buf = new uint8_t[p_dll_name_nalloc];
00519         memcpy(buf, p_dll_name->get_string().c_str(), p_dll_name->get_string().size());
00520         memset(buf+p_dll_name->get_string().size(), 0, p_dll_name_nalloc - p_dll_name->get_string().size());
00521         p_dll_name_rva.get_section()->write(f, p_dll_name_rva.get_rel(), p_dll_name_nalloc, buf);
00522         delete[] buf;
00523     }
00524 
00525     /* Import Lookup Table and Import Address Table (and indirectly, Hint/Name entries). According to the PE secification: "The
00526      * structure and content of the import address table are identical to those of the import lookup table, until the file is
00527      * bound." */
00528     if (p_ilt_rva>0)
00529         unparse_ilt_iat(f, p_ilt_rva, false, p_ilt_nalloc);
00530     if (p_iat_rva>0)
00531         unparse_ilt_iat(f, p_iat_rva, false, p_iat_nalloc);
00532     
00533     PEImportDirectory_disk disk;
00534     encode(&disk);
00535     section->write(f, idx*sizeof disk, sizeof disk, &disk);
00536 }
00537 
00538 
00540 void
00541 SgAsmPEImportDirectory::dump(FILE *f, const char *prefix, ssize_t idx) const
00542 {
00543     char p[4096];
00544     if (idx>=0) {
00545         sprintf(p, "%sPEImportDirectory[%zd].", prefix, idx);
00546     } else {
00547         sprintf(p, "%sPEImportDirectory.", prefix);
00548     }
00549 
00550     const int w = std::max(1, DUMP_FIELD_WIDTH-(int)strlen(p));
00551 
00552     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %s for %zu bytes", p, w, "dll_name_rva", p_dll_name_rva.to_string().c_str(), p_dll_name_nalloc);
00553     if (p_dll_name)
00554         fprintf(f, " \"%s\"", p_dll_name->get_string(true).c_str());
00555     fputc('\n', f);
00556 
00557     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %lu %s",        p, w, "time", (unsigned long)p_time, ctime(&p_time));
00558     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08x (%u)\n", p, w, "forwarder_chain", p_forwarder_chain, p_forwarder_chain);
00559     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %s for %zu bytes\n", p, w, "ilt_rva", p_ilt_rva.to_string().c_str(), p_ilt_nalloc);
00560     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %s for %zu bytes\n", p, w, "iat_rva", p_iat_rva.to_string().c_str(), p_iat_nalloc);
00561     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %zu\n",         p, w, "nentries", p_imports->get_vector().size());
00562 
00563     for (size_t i=0; i<p_imports->get_vector().size(); ++i) {
00564         SgAsmPEImportItem *import = p_imports->get_vector()[i];
00565         import->dump(f, p, i);
00566     }
00567 }
